title: Lebanon weary of unrest after deadly Hezbollah shootout
description: A suburb of Beirut erupted in gunfire Thursday, a day after clashes over an overturned truck left two people outside the city.

title: West African nations mobilize standby force as Niger crisis grinds on
description: West-African governments struggled to chart a clear path out of the crisis in Niger during an emergency summit on Thursday.

title: Biden asks for $20.6 billion for Ukraine as counteroffensive sputters
description: The U.S. has spent tens of billions to help Kyiv already but is calling for more aid.

title: Iran, U.S. advance deal to swap prisoners, free oil funds
description: The development marks a rare bright spot in U.S.-Iran relations, which have been marked by deep distrust and a failure to revive a nuclear agreement.

title: Who are the U.S. citizens being held in Iran?
description: At least three U.S. citizens were moved from the notorious Evin Prison to house arrest.

title: Yandex co-founder calls war ‘barbaric’ signaling dismay in Russian elite
description: Arkady Volozh became the second prominent Russian business executive to publicly denounce Russia's invasion, saying 'I am horrified about the fate of people in Ukraine.'

title: Assassination upends once-peaceful Ecuador days before election
description: The South American nation, wedged between Colombia and Peru, was already emerging as a new battlefield for drug traffickers. With the killing of Fernando Villavicencio, the violence has reached the highest levels of politics.

title: Who was Fernando Villavicencio, Ecuador’s assassinated presidential candidate?
description: Villavicencio, a vocal opponent of drug trafficking groups and government corruption, was shot dead at a rally in Quito. Here's what to know and what happens next.

title: Climate change may worsen spread of West Nile virus: What to know
description: Health experts worry that rising temperatures could mean West Nile, a mosquito-borne virus, will become more prevalent in less common places.

title: Soccer shocker: Australians, a nation of rugby league fans, fall for football
description: Australians are watching the women's World Cup games in numbers that surpass even the rugby league and "Aussie rules" finals.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Dozens of Leopard tanks bought for Ukraine; more drones target Moscow
description: It was not clear when the refurbished tanks from OIP Land Systems would reach Ukraine or who bought them.

title: Slow counteroffensive darkens mood in Ukraine
description: Nearly 18 months after Russia's invasion engulfed Ukrainians in a brutal war, the national narrative of unity and perseverance is beginning to fray.

title: As economy stumbles over judicial push, Israel banks on an energy boom
description: Natural gas has transformed Israel into a regional energy powerhouse. Now, the country is looking to increase exports to Europe to offset its economic woes.

title: China’s falling prices are a more profound problem than U.S. inflation
description: The United States and China are the world’s two most important economic powers. But the biggest economic problems they face are polar opposites.

title: Robbie Robertson, guitarist and songwriter of the Band, dies at 80
description: Mr. Robertson was credited with helping forge a new genre called Americana that blended country, folk and rock.

title: Ecuadoran presidential candidate killed in attack at campaign rally
description: Fernando Villavicencio, a member of the National Assembly before it was dissolved in May, was a leading candidate to succeed President Guillermo Lasso.
